page.title: 13Hythe Town Council
page.content:
Until 1974 Hythe was a borough with a council which operated all main survices in the town. After this date the former borough council of Hythe was abolished and its powers transferred to the new District Council called{Shepway.}Hythe was created a parish, but because of its size conferred on itself the status of the town. This gave the town the right to elect a{Town Mayor.
The Mayor or his deputy chairs each meeting of the Town Council. There are 18 Town Councillors in all. Their job in the meeting is to decide on how the Parish precept, raised through the rates, should be spent. The Council has to fund and administer allotment sites, recreation grounds and open spaces in the town.
